titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of Jerzy Tomaszewski, 1943-1945, at the Lilly Library, Indiana University
titlestmt.author: Ava Dickerson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-18 22:35:55 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The Tomaszewski Photographs mss., 1943-1945, consist of copies of photographs taken by Jerzy Tomaszewski throughout World War II in Poland.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jerzy Tomaszewski, 1924-2016, was a Polish wartime photojournalist and reporter best known for his photographs of the 1944 Warsaw Uprising.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of copies of photographs taken by Jerzy Tomaszewski throughout World War II in Poland, including concentration camps.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged following original order.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Tomaszewski Photographs mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
